item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no friend as loyal as a book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Andrew Wolfe
item.description: "A book without words is like love without a kiss; it's empty." -- Andrew Wolfe

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "From the moment I picked your book up until I laid it down, I convulsed with laughter. Someday I intend on reading it." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Cicero
item.description: "If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need." -- Cicero

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Charles W. Eliot
item.description: "Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers." -- Charles W. Eliot

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "A book, too, can be a star, a living fire to lighten the darkness, leading out into the expanding universe." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Horace Mann
item.description: "A house without books is like a room without windows." -- Horace Mann

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by William Styron
item.description: "A great book should leave you with many experiences, and slightly exhausted at the end. You live several lives while reading." -- William Styron

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Arnold Lobel
item.description: "Books to the ceiling, Books to the sky, My pile of books is a mile high. How I love them! How I need them! I'll have a long beard by the time I read them." -- Arnold Lobel

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Joseph Joubert
item.description: "The worst thing about new books is that they keep us from reading the old ones." -- Joseph Joubert

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Books may well be the only true magic." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Books are the ultimate Dumpees: put them down and they’ll wait for you forever; pay attention to them and they always love you back." -- John Green

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "Book collecting is an obsession, an occupation, a disease, an addiction, a fascination, an absurdity, a fate. It is not a hobby. Those who do it must do it. Those who do not do it, think of it as a cousin of stamp collecting, a sister of the trophy cabinet, bastard of a sound bank account and a weak mind." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Joseph-Daniel Peter Paul Abondius add a quote by Jane Smiley
item.description: "Many people, myself among them, feel better at the mere sight of a book." -- Jane Smiley
